== Join Us! == {{#ifeq:"{{NAMESPACE}}"|"User talk"| Hello and '''[[Wikibooks:Welcome, newcomers|welcome]]''' to [[Wikibooks]], a collection of open-content textbooks! You should consider [[Special:Userlogin|creating an account or logging in]]. Here are some advantages: * The use of a username of your choice. * Greater security and privacy, as your IP address will be hidden from most users. * You get your own personal user page and talk page, instead of having to share it. * [[Special:Contributions/{{PAGENAME}}|Your contributions]] will be recognized as your own, and not confused with anyone else's. * The use of your own watchlist which shows when pages you are interested in have been edited. * Your opinions carry greater weight in the [[Wikibooks:Decision making|decision making process]]. * You become a recognized member of the Wikibooks community. * Creating an account is easy and only takes a few minutes of your time, especially given the benefits. We hope that you choose to become a Wikibookian and [[Special:Userlogin|create an account]].
Feel free to ask any questions on my talk page or in the [[Wikibooks:Reading room|Reading room]].
Be sure to sign your posts and comments on talk pages with four tildes (~~~~), this will let other editors know you said it.
|
'''This template must only be used on User talk pages.'''
}}-- '''— [[User:Mike.lifeguard|Mike.lifeguard]]''' | [[User talk:Mike.lifeguard|talk]] 00:38, 27 June 2008 (UTC)

If you have questions about this, or need help, ask at the [[WB:HELP|Reading Room Assistance]] page. Thanks. --[[User:Jomegat|Jomegat]] ([[User talk:Jomegat|talk]]) 02:46, 27 June 2008 (UTC)}}

Since you are inactive at Wikibooks, we are considering giving your username to someone else who uses that username on other wikis. To do this, we will change your username to {{{name}}} (usurped). ==Themes== The simplest way to change the look of your quiz is to choose a new '''theme'''. This is very easy to do. Both the Standard and Professional versions of Question Writer come with a range of themes. You can find out when new themes are released by subscribing to the Question Writer Newsletter, or you can read the regular updates on the blog. [http://www.questionwriterblog.com] [[Image:QW3Themes.png|center]] To add or change the theme, click the 'Switch Themes' button. A list of themes will appear and you can select a different theme. A dialogue box will appear telling you that the theme has been changed. [[Image:QW3Themeslist.jpg|center]] You can then '''Preview''' the quiz to see how it looks with the new theme.
---- Go To [[../Fonts/]], [[../Text Formatting/]], [[../Include Image/]], [[../Adding Flash Animation/]], [[../Adding Audio/]], [[../Adjust Image Quality/]], [[../Change Background and Loader/]] {{BookCat}}

page.title: Question Writer Manual/Look and Feel/Include Image

revision.text:
==Include Image== You can add an image to each individual question by ticking the 'Add Image' checkbox in the question property details. You can follow the same steps to add audio or video content to your quiz. [[Image:QW3Add_image.png|center]] To '''add an image''', simply tick the include image box and then use the browser to select and insert the image of your choice. The image should be in a .jpg or .gif format. Once you have selected the image you want using the '''Add Files...''' button you click the '''Use File''' button and the image will appear in your question. [[Image:QW3Image.jpg|center]] If you want quiz takers to be able zoom the image with their mouse, tick the 'Use Image Zooming' checkbox in [[Question_Writer_Manual/Quiz_Options/Question_Options/General_Question_Properties|General Question Properties]]. {| |- | style="vertical-align: top" | [[Image:QW3 Pro star icon.png]] | style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 5px;" |If you have a Professional license,you can also adjust the image quality in [[../../Quiz Options/Appearance Settings/Jpeg Image Quality|Appearance Settings - Jpeg Image Quality]].{{clr}} |} ===Adding Images as Question Content=== {| |- | style="vertical-align: top" | [[Image:QW3 Pro star icon.png]] | style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 5px;" |If you have the Professional version of Question Writer you can also add images as part of the question (as well as the above method) and/or as part of the answer options. If you right click on the answer option on the relevant answer, and select '''Add''' then '''Content'''. By right clicking on '''Content''' you can then select '''Image'''. A window will open where you can add the image file that you need. [[Image:QW4 Add image content.jpg|center]] Adding images in this way gives you the option of setting the size of the image and it's alignment in the page. You can read more about adding content in [[Question_Writer_Manual/About_Questions/Question_Options|Question Options]].{{clr}} |}
---- Go To [[../Themes/]], [[../Fonts/]], [[../Text Formatting/]], [[../Adding Flash Animation/]], [[../Adding Audio/]], [[../Adjust Image Quality/]], [[../Change Background and Loader/]] {{BookCat}}

page.title: Question Writer Manual/Look and Feel/Adding Flash Animation

revision.text:
==Adding Flash Animation== You can add flash animations to a question by creating your animation with a Flash tool, exporting it as Flash 8 (or earlier) and attaching it to your question. You add your Flash animation file in the same way as you would add an image, see the section on [[../../About Questions/Adding Questions|Adding Questions]] for more information. Image zooming also applies to Flash content - if you want quiz takers to be able zoom the Flash content with their mouse, tick the 'Use Image Zooming' checkbox in the Question Options [[../../Quiz Options/Question Options/General Question Properties|General Question Properties]]. Usually if the Flash is interactive, you'll want this switched off. Using Flash content is a good way to include audio and video in your quiz.
---- Go To [[../Themes/]], [[../Fonts/]], [[../Text Formatting/]], [[../Include Image/]], [[../Adding Audio/]], [[../Adjust Image Quality/]], [[../Change Background and Loader/]] {{BookCat}}

page.title: Question Writer Manual/Look and Feel/Adding Audio

revision.text:
==Adding Audio== The steps that you will take to add audio to a question will vary depending on which version of Question Writer you are using. If you are using Question Writer 3 please follow this [[Question Writer Manual/Look and Feel/Adding Audio/Question Writer 3|link]]. You can add audio files to both the Question and to the Answer options (if you are a user with a Professional license) and the files can be in either MP3 or .swf format. ===Adding Audio to a Question=== There are two possible ways that you can add audio to a Question, though the second method is only available to users with a Professional license. The first method is to follow the steps for [[Question Writer Manual/Look_and_Feel/Include_Image|adding an image]], only instead of an image file you add your audio file. {| |- | style="vertical-align: top" | [[Image:QW3 Pro star icon.png]] | style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 5px;" |The second method is to right click on your question and select '''Add - Content''' [[File:QW4 Question content.jpg|center]] and then '''Add-Audio''' and select your audio file. [[File:QW4 Question content choices.jpg|center]] If you use this method you can adjust the alignment of the audio player in the page. [[File:Add audio content.jpg|center]]{{clr}} |} ===Adding Audio to Answer Options=== {| |- | style="vertical-align: top" | [[Image:QW3 Pro star icon.png]] | style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 5px;" |You can add audio to answer options in Partial Credit, Matching, Sequencing and Plugin Question types. To add audio to the Answer Options follow the steps shown in [[Question_Writer_Manual/About_Questions/Question_Options|the Adding Options]] section of the About Questions chapter.{{clr}} |} You will be able to see an example of an audio quiz online by following this link [http://www.centralquestion.com/accents].
---- Go To [[../Themes/]], [[../Fonts/]], [[../Text Formatting/]], [[../Include Image/]], [[../Adding Flash Animation/]], [[../Adjust Image Quality/]], [[../Change Background and Loader/]] {{BookCat}}

page.title: Question Writer Manual/Look and Feel/Adjust Image Quality

revision.text:
==Adjust Image Quality== {| |- | style="vertical-align: top" | [[Image:QW3 Pro star icon.png]] | style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 5px;" | If you have the Professional version of Question Writer, you can adjust the image quality of jpg images using the sliding scale in the [[../../Quiz Options/Appearance Settings/Jpeg Image Quality|Appearance Settings-Jpeg Image Quality]] properties window. {{clr}} |} In both Standard and Professional versions, you can also adjust the Flash Version of the published images in [[../../Quiz Options/Appearance Settings/Publish as Flash Version|Appearance Settings - Publish as Flash Version]]. Flash saved as version 8 will display a better resolution image.
---- Go To [[../Themes/]], [[../Fonts/]], [[../Text Formatting/]], [[../Include Image/]], [[../Adding Flash Animation/]], [[../Adding Audio/]], [[../Change Background and Loader/]] {{BookCat}}

page.title: Question Writer Manual/Look and Feel/Change Background and Loader

revision.text:
==Change Background and Loader Image== {| |- | style="vertical-align: top" | [[Image:QW3 Pro star icon.png]] | style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 5px;" | If you own the Professional Version you can customize the appearance of your quiz by adding your own background image and by changing the screen loader image. This is done as part of the Quiz Properties in [[../../Quiz Options/Appearance Settings/Override Background Images|Override Background Images]]. You add the images in the same way that you add an image to a question ([[../../About Questions|About Questions]]). You can use any .gif,.jpg or .swf (v8 or earlier). This means that your quiz can fit seamlessly into your website or corporate brand. For best results, use images with the same dimensions as the theme you are using. The most common size is 800x600. Higher resolution is generally better - but often a jpeg/bitmap style background won't look so good when it is resized for the browser. Instead - switch off the web setting, 'maximize in browser', or even better, use vector images inside a Flash file for the best results. === What Dimensions To Use === To find out the right dimensions for the theme you're using - deselect the web setting 'maximize in the browser', then publish for the web and have a look at the html code in the published file . . . there will be a line similar to, 
writeFlash("v"+rand(10)+"italy.swf","800","600"
The 800 and 600 are the exact dimensions that the theme uses. Alternatively, you can also look at the .qws or .qwz files directly with notepad to find the values . . . they look like
{{clr}} |}
---- Go To [[../Themes/]], [[../Fonts/]], [[../Text Formatting/]], [[../Include Image/]], [[../Adding Flash Animation/]], [[../Adding Audio/]], [[../Adjust Image Quality/]] {{BookCat}}

==Fonts (choice, embedded)== You can change the fonts and the font sizes used in the quiz in the text settings. See [[../../Quiz Options/Appearance Settings/Text Settings|Text Settings]] for more details.
---- Go To [[../Themes/]], [[../Text Formatting/]], [[../Include Image/]], [[../Adding Flash Animation/]], [[../Adding Audio/]], [[../Adjust Image Quality/]], [[../Change Background and Loader/]] {{BookCat}}

page.title: Question Writer Manual/Look and Feel/Text Formatting

revision.text:
==Text Formatting using HTML== You can choose to use HTML text formatting to change the appearance of text in your quiz, or to add special symbols. See [[Question Writer 3 Manual/Quiz Options/Appearance Settings/Text Settings|Text Settings]] for more detail.
---- Go To [[../Themes/]], [[../Fonts/]], [[../Include Image/]], [[../Adding Flash Animation/]], [[../Adding Audio/]], [[../Adjust Image Quality/]], [[../Change Background and Loader/]] {{BookCat}}

page.title: Question Writer Manual/Save and Publish/Save your Quiz

revision.text:
==Save your Quiz== When you are happy with the content, set up and appearance of your quiz, or for security while you are still working on it, you can save it. As with all Windows software to save your file simply select '''File''' and '''Save''' from the menu bar or click on the '''Save Quiz''' button on the tool bar. All quizzes are saved with a .qwz extension. If you wish to save the quiz under a new name, eg you have made some changes or additions to an existing quiz use the '''Save As''' option under File on the menu bar. [[Image:QW3Save.png|center]]
---- Go To [[../Question Writer Tracker/]], [[../Publish your Quiz/]], [[../Create a Web Page/]], [[../Publishing SCORM exams to Ecampus/WebCT/]], [[../Results/]] {{BookCat}}

page.title: Question Writer Manual/Save and Publish/Publish your Quiz

revision.text:
==Publish your Quiz==
To publish your quiz online select '''Publish''' from the menu bar. You are given five options: #'''[[/Publish to the Web/]]''' #'''[[/Publish to Question Writer Tracker/]]''' #'''[[/Publish for Printing/]]''' #'''[[/Publish to SCORM/]]''' #'''[[/Publish Questions in Text Format/]]''' (Professional edition only) #'''[[/Publish Inside PDF/]]''' (Professional edition only) #'''[[/Publish to QTI|Publish to QTI 1.2]]''' (Professional edition only) [[Image:QW Publish options.jpg|center]] ---- Go To [[../Save your Quiz/]], [[../Question Writer Tracker/]], [[../Create a Web Page/]], [[../Publishing SCORM exams to Ecampus/WebCT/]], [[../Results/]] {{BookCat}}

==Drag and Drop Questions between Quizzes== Question Writer makes it easy to drag and drop questions between quizzes. For example if you are writing a new quiz on capital cities and already have a quiz about European cities, you can simply open drag and drop the relevant questions into your new quiz.
---- Go To [[../Question Writer API/]], [[../Importing Questions/]], [[../Language Selector/]], [[../Flash Lite 2/]], [[../PlayStation Portable/]] {{BookCat}}

==Question Writer API== There is a code library to help creating Question Writer quizzes. If you'd like to export to the Question Writer format from your .NET application or website, you can use this [http://www.questionwriter.com/docs/QW_API.dll QW_API.dll] - there's also full documentation on how to use it [http://www.questionwriter.com/docs/CentralQuestion_Documentation_API_word2003.doc]
---- Go To [[../Drag and Drop|Drag and Drop Questions between Quizzes]], [[../Importing Questions/]], [[../Language Selector/]], [[../Flash Lite 2/]], [[../PlayStation Portable/]] {{BookCat}}

==Importing Questions== {| |- | style="vertical-align: top" | [[Image:QW3 Pro star icon.png]] | style="border-left: 1px solid #000000; padding-left: 5px;" | Question Writer Professional supports importing questions in two formats (click on the item to see more detail about formatting requirements): *[[../Importing Questions/Moodle XML format|Moodle XML format]] *[[../Importing Questions/text format|Text Format (.txt and .rtf)]] If you want to import a file, you simply select '''Import''' from the menu bar and click on either '''Text Format''' or '''Moodle XML'''. A pop up window will appear asking you to select the file that you want to import.{{clr}} |} [[Image:Qw3 text import.jpg|center]] A new quiz window will appear containing the questions that you have imported. You will have to enter your Quiz Title and Introduction Screen details, and set the quiz up for feedback etc. The importer doesn't always work perfectly - there can be a lot of variation in the way questions are formatted. If you experience difficultly importing a set of questions - send the file you're importing to '''support@questionwriter.com''' and we will do our best to correct any problems with the import routine.
---- Go To [[../Drag and Drop|Drag and Drop Questions between Quizzes]], [[../Question Writer API/]], [[../Language Selector/]], [[../Flash Lite 2/]], [[../PlayStation Portable/]] {{BookCat}}

revision.comment: adding Korean to list of languages
revision.text:
==Language Selector== You can change the language of Question Writer by using the language selector. You select the language you want to use in the '''Language''' menu that is visible before you've opened or created any quizzes in the interface. [[Image:QW Languageoptions.png|center]] After you've changed the language, you need to restart the application for the change to kick in. The languages currently supported are: *English *Danish *French *German *Icelandic *Italian *Korean *Portuguese *Spanish *Swedish *Japanese
---- Go To [[../Drag and Drop|Drag and Drop Questions between Quizzes]], [[../Question Writer API/]], [[../Importing Questions/]], [[../Flash Lite 2/]], [[../PlayStation Portable/]] {{BookCat}}

==Flash Lite 2== Flash Lite 2 is a Flash player for mobile phones [http://www.adobe.com/products/flashlite/]. Flash Lite 2 can manage basic Question Writer quizzes as long as the theme is kept simple and the questions are limited in number (about 10 with no feedback or 5 with feedback). This will improve as phones use more memory and better processors. There is some sample Question Writer content for FlashLite 2 [http://www.questionwriter.com/samples/flashlite](double size in browser, click here to download .swf to try on your phone [http://www.questionwriter.com/samples/flashlite/realtor.swf]). The sample uses the scenario of an estate agent (or realtor) entering details of a new rental property. It works well as a quick and easy form - it can be used for form filling in a situation where a keyboard isn't practical. It uses the texting mechanism so can be completed with one hand. Here's the theme download (.qws) [http://www.questionwriter.com/themes/flminimalism.qws] Android 2.2 supports Flash 10 and this is an excellent way to run your quizzes on mobile devices. The quizzes will run on Android 2.2 phones in the same way that they run on desktop browsers. Question Writer includes a theme with a 320x480 resolution that can be used for best effect with mobile phones. You can read some more about this and see Question Writer running on a phone using an Android app here: [http://www.centralquestion.com/archives/2009/08/flash_quiz_on_the_htc_hero.html]
---- Go To [[../Drag and Drop|Drag and Drop Questions between Quizzes]], [[../Question Writer API/]], [[../Importing Questions/]], [[../Language Selector/]], [[../PlayStation Portable/]] {{BookCat}}

==PlayStation Portable== The Playstation Portable is a mobile gaming device that now supports Flash 6, and so you can run Question Writer tests and quizzes on it. It has a large screen for a mobile device, with widescreen proportions (480x272). You can use the existing themes with the PSP, but it looks best with a theme that is specifically designed for it. Here's a sample quiz that we've made for the PSP, [http://www.questionwriter.com/samples/pspquiz] (or here, stretched for desktop use [http://www.questionwriter.com/samples/pspquiz/desktop.html]), the source for the quiz [http://www.questionwriter.com/source/tests/gamesknowledge.qwz], and the theme (.qws) [http://www.questionwriter.com/themes/bluenymph.qws] file too. Kudos to Radu Chiotan [http://www1.discreet.com/site/freelance.nsf/0/438eb324080814f285256d11003c4061?OpenDocument] for creating a great theme and Delia Mihai [http://www.delira.deviantart.com/gallery/] for the cool background. [[Image:QW3 Play Station.jpg|center]] When publishing for the PSP - there are a few things to take into account: #Turn off the '''[[../../Quiz Options/Web Settings/Browser Options|Maximize in browser]]''' option - this will ensure the quiz appears at the correct size. #Users can't use the keypad to tab between the buttons. Users must use the pointer device and X button. #It's a good idea to avoid the use of scrollbar, this will help to preserve memory on the device. #You'll get between 5 questions with feedback or 20 questions without running out of memory - it depends on all the factors that go into your quiz - more question types, with scrollbars and feedback, and complex buttons and themes all increase pressure on the memory and can lead to an 'out of memory' error on the device. #Users have to click once on the Flash before starting the quiz to focus/activate it. #Users can download tests and quizzes to use offline, or live on the internet. #The PSP runs quite a bit more slowly than desktop flash, users will have to wait a second or two after clicking a button for the effect to show up. #PSP supports Flash 6, but Flash 6 doesn't allow sending results to our service. There is a way around this if you send the results back to your own server. Flash 7 is required to use the 'Results by Email' service.
---- Go To [[../Drag and Drop|Drag and Drop Questions between Quizzes]], [[../Question Writer API/]], [[../Importing Questions/]], [[../Language Selector/]], [[../Flash Lite 2/]] {{BookCat}}

revision.comment: /* Defining a function with Mathematica */ typo
revision.text:
===Simple computations with Mathematica=== (1-1/7)*(1+2/3)^2
{\frac {50}{21}}
(25)^(1/2)
5\,
Factorial[15]
1307674368000\,
15!
1307674368000\,
Sqrt[81]
9\,
Sqrt[56.81]
7.537240874\,
%^2
56.81\,
===Using variables with Mathematica=== Like any other programming language, Mathematica allows us to assign values to named variables. This often makes programs more readable and it allows us to save results for use later in the calculation. Here, 2.14 is assigned to the variable ''p''. We can then compute p-\ln \left( p \right) so that ''p'' is evaluated (replaced by) as 2.14: p=2.14
2.14\,
p - Log[p]
1.379194171\,
You can also use more than one variable in a single expression: x = 2*a-p
2\,a- 2.14
x-Sqrt[a*p]
2\,a- 2.14- 1.462873884\,\sqrt {a}
expr = a*x^2 + b*x + c == 0
{a{x}} ^{2}+bx+c==0\,
===Commands to manipulate expressions in Mathematica=== Mathematica has a wide range of commands to help you manipulate expressions: f = (a+b)^6
f:=\left (a+b\right )^{6}
Expand[f]
{a}^{6}+6\,{a}^{5}b+15\,{a}^{4}{b}^{2}+20\,{a}^{3}{b}^{3}+15\,{a}^{2}{b}^{4}+6\,a{b}^{5}+{b}^{6}
Factor[%]
\left (a+b\right )^{6}
%%
{a}^{6}+6\,{a}^{5}b+15\,{a}^{4}{b}^{2}+20\,{a}^{3}{b}^{3}+15\,{a}^{2}{b}^{4}+6\,a{b}^{5}+{b}^{6}
Sin[x]^2+Cos[x]^2
\left (\sin(x)\right )^{2}+\left (\cos(x)\right )^{2}
Simplify[%]
1\,
Here, the ''%'' symbol recalls the last computation made by Mathematica. ''%%'' means you recalls the computation made two steps back. ''%%%'' will recall the answer to the computation make three steps back. If you wish to recall answers father back, you will have to have assigned them to a variable. You can also substitute values for the variables in an expression with the command ReplaceAll usually entered /. x^2+x+1 /.x->2
7\,
The command ''N'' calculates a floating point (numeric) approximation of an expression. You may also specify the desired precision. N[Sqrt[3]]
1.732050808\,
N[Sqrt[3], 50]
1.7320508075688772935274463415058723669428052538104\,
===Defining a function with Mathematica=== You define a function using patterns (_) and SetDelayed ( :=) f[t_]:=Sin[t] - t f[2*x + 2]
-2 x+\sin (2 x+2)-2
===Calculus with Mathematica=== Derivatives of expressions can be taken with the D command: D[f[t],t] Multiple partial derivatives can be given as a list. To take the derivative of g with respect to u then v: D[g[u,v,w],u,v] Mathematica can be used to find a primitive, indefinite integral or anti-derivative of an expression. Integrate[1/(1+x^3),x]
\frac{\tan ^{-1}\left(\frac{2 x-1}{\sqrt{3}}\right)}{\sqrt{3}}+\frac{1}{3} \log (x+1)-\frac{1}{6} \log \left(x^2-x+1\right)
Mathematica can also compute definite integrals: Integrate[f[t],{t,0,Pi}]
2-\frac{1}{2}\pi^2

NIntegrate is used for numerical integration: NIntegrate[f[t],{t,0,Pi}]
1.57079633\,
===Limits, sums and products with Mathematica=== You can also find numeric and symbolic values of sums, limits and products using respectively the functions ''sum'', ''limit'' and ''product'': Limit[(2*t-3)/(3*t+4),t->Infinity]
\frac{2}{3}
Limit[(2*t-3)/(3*t+4),t->-4/3,Direction->-1] (*right-bound of the limit*)
-\infty
Sum[i^2,{i,1,10}]
385\,
Product[1/i,{i,1,10}]
=\frac{1}{3628800}
===Solving equations with Mathematica=== The ''Solve[eqn,x]'' function tries to find the value of ''x'' in ''eqn''. You can also use more variables or more equations using ''Solve[{eqn1,eqn2,...},{x,y,...}] Solve[2*t+3==-t+6*Sqrt[2]]
\left\{\left\{t\to -1+2 \sqrt{2}\right\}\right\}
Solve[t-15/4*u==5/2*(u-t)+3,u]
\left\{\left\{u\to \frac{2}{25} (7 t-6)\right\}\right\}
Solve[{a-b==2,a+3*b==7},{a,b}]
\left\{\left\{a\to \frac{13}{4},b\to \frac{5}{4}\right\}\right\}
The following Mathematica sequence will find the determinant of the 6×6 matrix whose ''i'', ''j'''th entry contains ''ij''. In[1]:= Det[Array[Times, {6, 6}]] Out[1]= 0 So the determinant of such a matrix is 0 (i.e. it is singular). The following numerically calculates the root of the equation ''e''''x'' = ''x''2 + 2, starting at the point ''x'' = -1. In[2]:= FindRoot[Exp[x] == x^2 + 2, {x, -1}] Out[2]= {x -> 1.3190736768573652} Mathematica can do integral and differential calculus, in particular evaluation of integrals in terms of special functions. For example: In[3]:= Integrate[x/Sin[x], x]//OutputForm Out[3]= x (Log[1 - EI x] - Log[1 + EI x]) + I (PolyLog[2, -EI x] - PolyLog[2, EI x]) Here, E and I are the fundamental constants e and i respectively, and PolyLog[s,z] is the polylogarithm function \mathrm{Li}_s\left(z\right). Symbolic sums can be calculated. For example: In[4]:= Sum[z^k/k^s, {k, 1, Infinity}] Out[4]= PolyLog[s, z] {{BookCat}}

==Control Flow== ===If Statements=== ===For Loop=== For[start, test, incr, body] executes start, then repeatedly evaluates body and incr until test fails to give True. ''Example:
'' 
For[x=1, x<5, x=x+1, Print["x=",x]]
===While Loop=== While[test, body] evaluates test, then body, repetitively, until test first fails to give True. ''Example:
'' Define a Function f[x] 
f[x_] := (x^2 -1)/(x+1)
Use the function in a while loop to calculate the sum of those terms. 
i=0; While[i < 0, tot += f[i]; i++].
Note that the roles of ; and , are reversed relative to the C programming language. [[Category:Mathematica]]

=== Common structures and manipulations === One guiding principle in Mathematica is a unified structure behind almost all objects representable in Mathematica. For example, the expression <math>x^4+1</math> if entered will be represented as if it were written: <small>In[8]:=</small> x^4 + 1 <small>Out[8]=</small> 1+x<sup>4</sup>
If the <tt>FullForm</tt> command is used on this expression however: <small>In[9]:=</small> FullForm[x^4 + 1] <small>Out[9]=</small> Plus[1, Power[x, 4]]
All objects in Mathematica, except atomic ones such as symbols, numbers, and strings, have the basic form ''head''[''e''<sub>1</sub>, ''e''<sub>2</sub>, ''...''] (which may be displayed or entered in some other fashion). For example, the head of the above expression is <tt>Plus</tt>. Lists have this structure too, where the head is <tt>List</tt>, and the elements are ''e''<sub>1</sub>, ''e''<sub>2</sub>, etc. The concept of ''head'' is defined for atomic objects as well (<tt>Symbol</tt> for symbols, <tt>Integer</tt> for whole numbers, etc.), but they have no extractable subparts.
This principle permits ordinary expressions unrelated to lists to be operated on with list operators: <small>In[10]:=</small> Expand[(Cos[x] + 2 Log[x^11])/13]<nowiki>[[2, 1]]</nowiki> <small>Out[10]=</small> 2/13 The reverse can also occur -- lists can be modified to behave like ordinary expressions: <small>In[11]:=</small> Map[Apply[Log, #] &, {{2, x}, {3, x}, {4, x}}] <small>Out[11]=</small> {Log[x]/Log[2], Log[x]/Log[3], Log[x]/Log[4]} where the <tt>Apply</tt> function changes the head of its second argument to that of the first, and <tt>Map</tt> behaves like the [[higher-order function|map function]] found in many functional languages. Note that <tt>Log[b,x]</tt> is the base <tt>b</tt> logarithm, which is [[Logarithm#Change of base|converted]] to <tt>Log[x]/Log[b]</tt> on input.
Because of this equivalence between a regular mathematical object represented in Mathematica to that of a simple list structure, some built-in Mathematica functions permit ''threading'', where functions map themselves over lists without much further specification. Indeed, <tt>Apply</tt> threads itself over lists when invoked as <small>In[12]:=</small> Apply[Log, {{2,x}, {3,x}, {4,x}}, 1] <small>Out[12]=</small> {Log[x]/Log[2], Log[x]/Log[3], Log[x]/Log[4]} where the third argument being a 1 specifies that <tt>Apply</tt> replaces the heads of its argument only at the first level in the list, which is what we want, and is equivalent to the above example.
{{BookCat}}

[[Category:Mathematica|List of functions]]

To produce a simple 2D plot of ''f(x)'' versus x use the "Plot" command. The simple plot structure is written as "Plot[f(x),{x,lower_bound,upper_bound}]". ''Example:'' Plot[x^2+4,{x,-5,5}]; Two functions can be plotted together using the form "Plot[{f(x),g(x)},{x,lower_bound,upper_bound}]". ''Example:'' Plot[{x^2 + 4, 10 Sin[x]}, {x, -5, 5}]; [[category:Mathematica|Basic Plotting]]

revision.text:
{{recipe}} | [[Cookbook:Vegan cuisine|Vegan Cuisine]] {{recipesummary|Cookie recipes|Three dozen|10-11 minutes or until brown.|2}}
== Ingredients ==
* ½ cup non-dairy [[Cookbook:Shortening|shortening]] * ½ cup non-dairy [[Cookbook:Margarine|margarine]] * 1 cup brown sugar * ½ a banana * 8-12 oz. vegan chocolate chips * 2 tsp (5ml) baking powder * 1 tsp (5ml) [[Cookbook:Salt|salt]] * 2 cups [[Cookbook:Flour|flour]] (whole wheat pastry flour recommended but all-purpose white also works)
== Procedure ==
#Preheat oven to 350°F (180°C). #Cream shortening, margarine, and sugar together in a mixer. #Add banana to the sugar and butter mixture. #Mix all the dry ingredients together. Slowly add to the wet mixture. #Add chocolate chips. #Roll small portions into balls and place on a cookie sheet. #Bake 10-11 minutes, or until slightly browned.
Yields about three dozen.
== Notes, Tips, and Variations ==
* Nuts and/or dried fruit can be substituted for the chocolate chips to yield cookies of many delicious varieties.
[[Category:Vegan recipes|Whole wheat bread]] [[Category:Cookie recipes|Chocolate Chip Cookies (Vegan)]]

===Introduction to Modx=== You may have heard of Joomla! or Drupal or any other number of CMS's, but they all have the same, uneditable, uniform feel to them. There is no way to break free of the bonds that tie you down to the system. This is not true with a relatively new addition to the CMS scene, Modx. Modx is powerful and fast, while still being 100% customizable in every way. It does not matter what you want to do in Modx, if it can be done in PHP, it can be done in this powerhouse of a framework. ==What is Modx?== Modx is several things. It is a customizable web application builder, a website builder, a content management system (CMS) and much more. Basically, it is a powerful tool for creating almost anything you want in an easy to use graphical user interface (GUI).
[[category:Modx|Introduction to Modx]]

[[Wikibooks:Welcome|Welcome]] to Wikibooks, Taslack!
{| cellspacing="0" cellpadding="0" style="margin:0em 0em 1em 0em; width:100%" | style="width:45%; vertical-align:top; border:1px solid #fad67d; background-color:#faf6ed;" |
[[Image:Crystal Clear app korganizer.png|20px]] '''First steps tutorial'''
'''Wikibooks is for freely-licensed collaboratively-developed [[WB:WIW|textbooks]].'''
You don't need technical skills in order to contribute here. '''[[WB:BOLD|Be bold]]''' contributing here and ''[[WB:AGF|assume good faith]]'' for the intentions of others. Remember, this is a ''[[w:wiki|wiki]]'', so you're allowed to change just about anything & it is really easy. Come say [[WB:HELP|hello]] to everyone!
[[Image:Icon apps query.svg|20px]] '''Getting help'''
* You can always get help from the community in the [[Wikibooks:Reading room|Reading room]] or in our [[irc:wikibooks|IRC channel]]. * If something you wrote was tagged with {{tlx|query}}, and you think this was done in error, just remove it & explain why on the talk page. * If your upload was tagged with {{tlx|nld}}, {{tlx|bfu}}, or {{tlx|nfur}}, please read the template message as it explains the violation of [[WB:MEDIA|our media policy]]. Please be sure to provide the required {{tlx|information}}: a [[WB:ICT|license tag]] & source are always required; fair use images require a {{tlx|fair use rationale}}. | style="padding:0em 0.5em 0em 0.5em;" | | style="width:55%; vertical-align:top; border:1px solid #abd5f5; background-color:#f1f5fc;" |
[[Image:Transmission icon.png|20px]] '''Goodies, tips and tricks'''
* Please [[:w:Wikipedia:Sign your posts on talk pages|sign your name]] on discussion pages by typing ~~~~ * If you're coming here from Wikipedia, you should read [[WB:WFW|our primer for Wikipedians]] to get up-to-speed quickly. * '''Please make sure you follow our [[WB:NP|naming policy]]''' - modules should be named like Book Title/Chapter Title. * User scripts can make many tasks easier. Look at the ''Gadgets'' tab of [[Special:Preferences|''my preferences'']]; check off the boxes for the scripts you want, and hit ''save''!
[[Image:Nuvola filesystems trashcan full.png|20px]] '''Made a mistake?'''
* Need to rename a page? Use the ''move'' tab (only become available once your account is 4 days old - until then, ask for [[WB:HELP|help]]). * To get a page deleted, add {{tlx|delete|''your reason for requesting deletion''}} to the top of the page. * If something you wrote was deleted, please read the [[WB:DP|deletion policy]], and check the [[Special:Log/delete|deletion log]] to find out why. Also check the [[WB:VFD|VFD]] archives if applicable. You can request undeletion at [[WB:VFU]].
Thanks  '''— [[User:Mike.lifeguard|Mike.lifeguard]]''' | [[User talk:Mike.lifeguard|talk]] 21:38, 27 June 2008 (UTC)
|- |align=right colspan=3|(P.S. Would you like to provide [[Template talk:Bigwelcome|feedback]] on this message?) |} ==[[:The Missoula Montana Outdoors]]== {{mbox|type=notice|msg= [[:The Missoula Montana Outdoors|This page]] appears to have been created in error (due to a test, or some kind of [[Help:Editing|misplaced edit]]). It might be a [[Help:Stub|stub]], if so, please use [[Talk:The Missoula Montana Outdoors|the discussion page]] as to explain what this page is about. If it evolves into a [[WB:WIW|legitimate Wikibooks module]], you may remove the tag. If not fixed, explained, or improved, it will automatically be considered a candidate for [[Wikibooks:Deletion policy#Speedy deletions|speedy deletion]] in 7 days.  '''— [[User:Mike.lifeguard|Mike.lifeguard]]''' | [[User talk:Mike.lifeguard|talk]] 21:38, 27 June 2008 (UTC) }}

revision.text:
{{Chess Opening Theory/Position|= |Sicilian Defence, Najdorf Variation| |rd| |bd|qd|kd|bd| |rd|= | |pd| |nd|pd|pd|pd|pd|= |pd| | |pd| |nd| | |= | | | | | | |bl| |= | | | |nl|pl| | | |= | | |nl| | | | | |= |pl|pl|pl| | |pl|pl|pl|= |rl| | |ql|kl|bl| |rl|= || }} =Sicilian Defence, Najdorf Variation= Moves: '''1.e4 c5 2.Nf3 d6 3.d4 cxd4 4. Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6.Bg5 Nbd7''' This knight move is a natural one in the Najdorf, and it also stops Bxf6, doubling the Black pawns. Although not as popular as the move 6...e6, it is a solid, respectable alternative to the main line. Both sides will usually castle queenside. Black, using his knights and light-squared bishop, will attempt to pressure e4. White, on the other hand, will try to get play on the a2-g8 diagonal and the central files. ==Theory table== {{Chess Opening Theory/Table}}. '''1.e4 c5 2.Nf3 d6 3.d4 cxd4 4.Nxd4 Nf6 5. Nc3 a6 6.Bg5 Nbd7'''
7 8 9 10
Main line [[/7. Bc4|Bc4]]
Qa5		 Qd2
e6		 O-O-O
b5		 Bb3
Bb7		 =
{{ChessMid}} ==References== {{reflist}} {{Wikipedia|Sicilian Defence, Najdorf Variation}} de Firmian, Nick. Modern Chess Openings. McKay Chess Library, New York: 2008. {{Chess Opening Theory/Footer}} [[fi:Shakkiaapinen/Peli/1. e4/1...c5/2. Rf3/2...d6/3. d4/3...cxd4/4. Rxd4/4...Rf6/5. Rc3/5...a6/6. Lg5]]
